Pre-Game Insights: Oman cricket team coach Duleep Mendis has seen a vast improvement in the mental aspect of his side since he took over.
Mendis believes his team has the ability to do well and move forward in the tournament.
Oman, ranked 18th in the world on the ICC T20I team rankings, aims to secure a spot in the 'Super 12' stage.
PNG, ranked three places higher than Oman, enters the tournament opener with confidence.
The PNG squad is the first group of players to represent the country at a men's World Cup.
Oman is co-hosting the tournament, giving them home advantage for the opening week.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The opening match will be held at the Al Amerat Cricket Stadium, giving Oman home advantage.
Possible Oman playing XI: Jatinder Singh, Aqib Ilyas, Ayaan Khan, Zeeshan Maqsood, Mohammad Nadeem, Sandeep Goud, Naseem Khushi, Kaleemullah, Khawar Ali, Fayyaz Butt, Bilal Khan.
Possible Papua New Guinea playing XI: Assad Vala, Tony Ura, Charles Amini, Sese Bau, Norman Vanua, Simon Atai, Kiplin Doriga, Jason Kila, Nosaina Pokana, Damien Ravu, Chad Soper.
